thread.title: Crowell Focused on UMD, Not Opponent
thread.title_full: Crowell Focused on UMD, Not Opponent

title: Crowell Focused on UMD, Not Opponent
text:
Crowell Focused on UMD, Not Opponent 
By Zach Schneider September 30, 2015 Updated Sep 30, 2015 at 10:01 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- Maura Crowell is very familiar with this weekend's opponent for her University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) women's hockey team, but she says she's completely focused on her team at this point in the season. 
The Bulldogs will be on the road to play against No. 2 Boston College, which is a program Crowell coached against several times during her five years on the Harvard coaching staff. 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
That previous experience, however, won't be a factor in this weekend's series. 
"We are still trying to figure out how good we're going to be, so I think it's more about us," Crowell said. "I think it's about sharpening our tools and focusing on the little things. That's what we've been talking about since the start of the season." 
UMD is (2-0-0) thus far in the 2015-16 season after a sweep this past weekend on the road against Lindenwood.
